name: Countries are categorised as low, medium and high risk based on their risk rating

testSteps.description: Example #1: {Risk Factor=7 or above, Risk Rating=High, Sample Country=Iran}

children.description: When the country has a risk factor that is 7 or above, such as Iran
Then the risk rating should be High

testSteps.description: Example #2: {Risk Factor=5 to 7, Risk Rating=Medium, Sample Country=Nicaragua}

children.description: When the country has a risk factor that is 5 to 7, such as Nicaragua
Then the risk rating should be Medium

testSteps.description: Example #3: {Risk Factor=Below 5, Risk Rating=Low, Sample Country=Estonia}

children.description: When the country has a risk factor that is Below 5, such as Estonia
Then the risk rating should be Low

userStory.narrative:
Both country of origin and country of domicile are used as factors in determining whether the bank wishes to do business with a given customer.
  Each country is given a risk coefficient between 0 (low risk) and 10 (high risk).

  For example:

  {Examples} Each country has a risk rating based on anti-money-laundering and anti-corruption considerations

  The full country list should be provided by the reference data service.

  Countries are categorised as low, medium and high risk based on their score.

  For example:

  {Examples} Countries are categorised as low, medium and high risk based on their risk rating


  The country risk for a customer is based on their country of domicile and their country of origin, as shown below:

  {Examples} Overall customer risk is based on country of origin and country of domicile

  More detailed examples are provided in the scenarios.

title: Countries are categorised as low, medium and high risk based on their risk rating
